name: Invesco QQQ Trust
description: Invesco QQQ Trust, commonly referred to as QQQ, is a prominent exchange-traded fund (ETF) that seeks to track the performance of the Nasdaq-100 Index. Launched in 1999, QQQ has grown to become one of the most widely traded ETFs in the world, providing investors with exposure to 100 of the largest non-financial companies listed on the Nasdaq Stock Market. This includes renowned companies in technology, consumer discretionary, healthcare, and other sectors, with a heavy emphasis on technology giants such as Apple, Microsoft, and Amazon. QQQ is designed for investors looking for growth potential, and its performance is often viewed as a barometer of the broader technology sector. The fund employs a passive management strategy, which means it aims to replicate the index's performance rather than actively selecting stocks. With its liquidity, transparency, and low expense ratio, Invesco QQQ Trust has attracted a diverse range of investors—from individual traders to institutional investors—seeking to capitalize on the performance of leading growth companies. The trust continues to innovate by incorporating new options and strategies to enhance its appeal and effectiveness for various investment objectives.

key_executives.name: Nick D. Dorsey
key_executives.position: Managing Director, Head of ETF Product Management

faq.question: What is Invesco QQQ Trust?
faq.answer: Invesco QQQ Trust is an exchange-traded fund that seeks to replicate the performance of the Nasdaq-100 Index.

faq.answer: Invesco QQQ Trust is managed by Invesco Ltd.

faq.question: What types of companies are included in QQQ?
faq.answer: QQQ includes 100 of the largest non-financial companies listed on the Nasdaq, with a focus on technology.

faq.question: When was QQQ launched?
faq.answer: Invesco QQQ Trust was launched in 1999.
